Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2008 03:24PM katydidnt wrote: Hi, I had an implant removed, after 7 months, due to an infection that came out of nowhere.  Then, afterward, there was a small area around the incision that wouldn't heal.  I went 4 months with pads in my bra, and packing the wound.  Finally, they sent me to hyperbaric O2 treatments.  After just 7 treatments, (one week), my wound finally healed.  What an ordeal....I suspect my skin was compromised by having radiation after the tissue expander insertion, and prior to the final implant placement.  It was too much for my body to heal properly.  Did you have radiation also?  I think you should have it out....hopefully, you will heal and then wait a year or so and try again.   Good Luck and I hope you feel better soon,
Posts.Title: incision won't close after mastectomy and implant grrlcancer macb04

Posts.Content: katydidnt wrote: I'm a new poster here.  I was diagnosed almost 5 years ago, had mastectomy, 10 nodes removed, implant reconstruction (later removed), chemo, rads,  the whole nine yards. You know the drill - Here is my problem: I made it through treatment and its complications, but I've had chronic pain under my arm/chest wall region for the past 4.5 years.  I see pain management people who have me on meds which help me to overcome the pain, but it is insidious and although meds help with normal function, they often make me feel foggy and tired.  I work part-time, couldn't ever see me going back to work full time the way I feel. My question to readers is, is there anyone out there who has tried alternative solutions to this problem, i.e. accupuncture with success, or surgery.  I'm told that surgery will only make the nerve endings grow back bigger and angrier.  I'm seeing a neurologist next month out of desperation. Any thoughts or suggestions are greatly appreciated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pain - chronic post-pastectomy pain disorder katydidnt hipchik47
